content.title: Struggling with Elasticsearch/Opensearch
content.subtitle: Discover 140x lower cost and extremely low maintenance of ZincObserve.

items.title: ZincObserve is Built for log search from ground up
items.desc: ZincObserve was built from ground up for log search and is heavily optimized for it. It is not a general purpose search engine like Elasticsearch where log search and observability was an afterthought.

items.title: Lower your storage cost of log strage by 140x
items.desc: ZincObserve does not rely on indexing of the data. It stores un-indexed data in compressed format in local disk or object store in parquet columnar format. This allows for much lower compute requirement during data ingestion and very high compression rates resulting in ~140x lower storage cost. No indexing of data means that full scan searches may be slower than Elasticsearch but should still be fast due to multiple other techniques like partitioning and caching.

items.title: Full Elasticsearch compatibility
items.desc: APIs of ZincObserve are fully compatible with Elasticsearch. This means that you can use ZincObserve as a drop-in replacement for Elasticsearch. You can use ZincObserve with any existing tooling that works with Elasticsearch.

items.title: Extremely low operational effort
items.desc: Due to stateless nodes and no indexing, ZincObserve requires very low operational effort. You can run ZincObserve on Kubernetes or on bare metal. You can also run ZincObserve on AWS, GCP or Azure. ZincObserve is also available as a fully managed service on AWS and GCP.
